data.title: The 80+ Best Movies With Lord in the Title
data.meta_description: The 80+ Best Movies With Lord in the Title, as voted on by fans. Current Top 3: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, The Lord of the Rings: The Return of ...
data.text:
Ranked By

321 votes

48 voters

How many movies with lord in the title can you name? This list ranks the best movies with lord in the name, whether they're documentaries, dramas, horror movies, or any other genre of film. Do you have a favorite movie with lord in the title? Categorizing movies by words in their titles is kind of uncommon, but that's a big part of why this list is so fun to scroll through. There's probably one movie with lord in the title you think of right away, but you might be shocked to see how many others exist as well.

Notable films with lord in the title include The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, and The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, although there are many more examples on this list. This poll is interactive, meaning you can vote the lord movies up or down depending on how much you like them.

Released : 2002

Directed by : Peter Jackson

This epic fantasy film is the second installment in the Lord of the Rings trilogy, directed by Peter Jackson. It captures the thrilling journey of the scattered members of the Fellowship as they battle the forces of evil while trying to save Middle-earth. With breathtaking visuals and a powerful storyline, The Two Towers is nothing short of a cinematic masterpiece.

Released : 2003

Directed by : Peter Jackson

The climactic conclusion to Peter Jackson's Lord of the Rings trilogy, The Return of the King, sees the final efforts to destroy the One Ring and defeat Sauron's evil forces. Featuring mesmerizing battles, incredible performances, and an emotional farewell, this film is a stunning finale that has earned its place among the greats in cinematic history.

Released : 2001

Directed by : Peter Jackson

The first installment in Peter Jackson's renowned Lord of the Rings trilogy, The Fellowship of the Ring introduces viewers to the rich and fantastical world of Middle-earth. As the menacing power of Sauron looms large, a diverse group bands together to protect the One Ring and keep it out of enemy hands. With stunning visuals and a gripping tale, this film sets the stage for a truly breathtaking trilogy.

Released : 1990

Directed by : Harry Hook

Based on William Golding's classic novel, this harrowing adaptation tells the story of a group of boys stranded on a deserted island after a plane crash. As they struggle for survival, the boys grapple with their newfound freedom and the darkness that lurks within human nature. A chilling exploration of the human psyche, this film is a must-watch for fans of psychological thrillers.

Charlton Heston, Richard Boone, Rosemary Forsyth

Released : 1965

Directed by : Franklin J. Schaffner

In this 1965 historical drama, Charlton Heston stars as a battle-weary Norman knight who's given possession of a castle and village in 11th-century France. Faced with challenges from both within and outside his walls, our protagonist must balance love, ambition, and duty in the tumultuous medieval period. A fascinating glimpse into the past, The War Lord is full of intrigue and excitement.

Released : 1978

Directed by : Ralph Bakshi

Before Peter Jackson's blockbuster adaptation, there was Ralph Bakshi's animated version of J.R.R. Tolkien's classic tale. Released in 1978, this ambitious film condenses the first two books of the trilogy, following the Fellowship as they traverse Middle-earth and evade danger at every turn. Though not as polished as later adaptations, this film is a fascinating piece of history for any Tolkien enthusiast.
